rComments: He knows algebra really well! Engaging lectures, willing to explain things if you ask about them. Sections do all the homework.

Very proof-centric. If you can't write proofs, stay away. Doesn't provide review sheets, or answers for homework or midterm. Does provide a clear explanation in class and PDF notes. Closely follows book. 4 of 7 final Qs were proofs, and a score < 50% was an automatic F. Many with good HW and midterm scores and ability to do computational Qs failed.

I liked Mason up until the final. The final was unfair and the class was uncurved. Mason's lectures are very clear and he's interesting enough, but he does have difficult answering questions well. Mason doesn't do much to help you prepare for tests.

My favorite math professor by far! Each lecture is self-contained and can be understood without reading the text, yet still manages to fill in the gaps. Doesn't tolerate nonsense, but is helpful. Absolutely brilliant! Homework can be virtually impossible without the TA. Tests were very easy.

Prof Mason was a great teacher. Lectures were well ordered and clear. His tests were challenging but fair, and he was helpful during office hours. He also helped me a few times outside of office hours.

This guy has a reputation for being a bad teacher, and in my opinion he isn't great, but not as bad as people say.  I had him for 100 and I thought it was pretty easy.  He could have done a better job explaining it, but the material in that class isn't too bad.  Point is, if you get stuck with him for math 100, it's not so bad

This guy was the funniest teacher i've ever had.   Problem was, he was trying to teach and wasn't making jokes.  It was like a Monty Python skit, he kept putting his head under the overhead and didn't know, stumping himself and the TA's with impossibly hard example problems in class, having to borrow paper and pens in class to do examples.  Nut.

Mason is an quirky guy.  He's absolutely brilliant, and is a revered mathematician in the field of abstract algebra.  However, he's a mediocre TEACHER.  I definitely understand the material after attending class and studying rigorously, but he could have been better. He is very impersonal, and takes offense to all but the most thoughtful comments.

Horrible teacher, notes were hard to read and not helpful, unprepared for class during lectures, refused to make sample midterm/final or post sample questions because it was too much work, unresponsive to students w/ questions or concerns, and majority of class failed midterm/final.

The class was ridiculous. I worked so hard and came out barely making it through. I don't know where he went wrong, but the class just did not work.  I would not recommend taking math 100 with this guy. However when I went to office hours he was interested in helping me understand.

positively the WORST math teacher EVER. I'm sure he's brilliant, however his lectures are mind numbing and he's consistently unprepared for class. His tests were fair but over half the class failed and the exam #1 average was a 9/30!!!! Awful. Just skip this teacher if you can.

The worst math professor ever.He elaborates the same type of example problem so much that you forget what you're learning.On top of that his hand writing is horrible.There were days when I couldn't take notes and he can't read his own words.About 75% of his undergrads and grad students failed the first midterm.Skip the math quarter if he teaches it

He was a great Calculus professor.  He breaks everything down in plain English, rather than leaving his students to fend for themselves in the text.  I recomment him definitely.  He also is quite fun to talk to and incredibly intelligent.

They don't get any worse than this.  This is the worst professor/teacher I've ever had...EVER.  I'm sure a pre-school teacher could teach this class better than he did.  The grading system was so messed up, I was getting an A going into the final, and because I didn't get 50% of his BS 8 problem final correct, I failed the class.

The man is a math teacher and i'm not sure if he doesn't know the diffrence between delta and sigma, or if his handwriting is so bad that he can't draw a triangle.  I can't write anymore without swearing.  AVOID THIS MAN, i feel not as Smrtist for taking his class.

Most disorganized teacher Ive ever had. Forgot to bring notes and paper to class, never gave us a syllabus, and made his midterm so hard the whole class failed. His teaching is miserable and he doesn't seem to notice or care. Can't even read his writing. Don't take his class if you can in any way avoid it.

Was very unhelpful, didn't seem to really care about the students concerns.  He wouldn't even consider a curve of some sort when over 70% of the class failed the midterm.  He simply offered the exact same midterm but would not give partial credit for the problems on it.  He tends to be unprepared and has horrible handwriting.

He doesn't seem to know what he is doing. He can't even remember to bring pens paper notes and anything else that he needs to teach but he sure can remember his orange and tea. He refuses to work on his handwritting and he needs to learn how to teach. He can't even do his own example problems.
I had a grasp of the material for this course before I took it. I now feel more stupid..er. :(
